definition: surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites
to go to church on Sunday (of Christians)

sentences.english: Christian dedication and faithfulness in worshiping, studying the Word, receiving the sacrament.
sentences.chinese: 在做礼拜，学习圣经，领圣餐时基督徒的奉献和忠诚。

sentences.english: The Hendersons seldom go to church, but they believe.
sentences.chinese: 亨德森一家很少去教堂做礼拜，但他们笃信宗教。

sentences.english: Saturday was the representative work of periodicals of civil literature in early Minguo.
sentences.chinese: 《礼拜六》是民国初年市民文学期刊的代表作。

sentences.english: She goes to church every Sunday.
sentences.chinese: 她每个星期天都去做礼拜。

sentences.english: I will answer for it that we shall find no inconvenience from narrow roads on Wednesday.
sentences.chinese: 我敢保险，礼拜三我们不会因为路窄遇到什么麻烦。

sentences.english: The week began with forecasts of huge public-sector job losses.
sentences.chinese: 这个礼拜一开始就有传言，说要大量裁员。

sentences.english: You see this is a two-storey prayer hall.
Did he take away the jade bracelets and agate necklace i gave you last week ?
sentences.chinese: 他有没有拿走上个礼拜我给你的玉镯子和玛瑙项链？

sentences.english: Coule I see M.r Green sometime this week?
sentences.chinese: 我能不能在这个礼拜的某个时候见见格林先生？

sentences.english: It was a cold winter’s day that Sunday.
sentences.chinese: 这是冬季里的一个寒冷的礼拜天。

sentences.english: I mean, I did get out for two sessions of skate-skiing this week already, about 30 kilometers each.
sentences.chinese: 这礼拜我确实已经出去滑了两次雪，每次里程3万米。

sentences.english: No worries though, because I am back in business this week.
sentences.chinese: 但是别担心，因为我这礼拜因为生意上的事又回来了。

sentences.english: MR. YAMAMOTO: Saturday is our busy day at the store.
sentences.chinese: 礼拜六是店里最忙的一天。

sentences.english: It's bridge club day. Every fourth Wednesday a the month.
sentences.chinese: 每个月的第四个礼拜三是她们的桥牌聚会日。

sentences.english: My elbow banged against the door last week and it still hurt.
sentences.chinese: 我的胳膊肘在一个礼拜前撞在了门上，到现在还很疼。

sentences.english: Can have two whole days every week to crawl on the checkers without disturbance.
sentences.chinese: 一个礼拜可以有两天时间在家踏踏实实地爬格子。

definition: to go to church on Sunday (of Christians)
